alert.note: Alert for Genesee; Livingston; Northern Erie; Ontario; Wyoming (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 29 at 7:50AM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of central and western New York, including the following counties, in central New York, Northern Cayuga. In western New York, Genesee, Livingston, Monroe, Niagara, Northern Erie, Ontario, Orleans, Southern Erie, Wayne and Wyoming. * WHEN...Until 5 PM EDT this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A area of heavy rain will move across the watch area and will interact with a stalled boundary. There is a potential for locally heavy rainfall, which may impact urban areas, including Buffalo and Rochester. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Genesee; Livingston; Northern Erie; Ontario; Wyoming
